html: Unemployment in the North East fell by 3,000 to 56,000 between May and July. The rate of 4.4% remains above the UK average, but is below London (4.7%), the West Midlands (4.6%) and the North West (4.5%).
text: Unemployment in the North East fell by 3,000 to 56,000 between May and July. The rate of 4.4% remains above the UK average, but is below London (4.7%), the West Midlands (4.6%) and the North West (4.5%).

html: UK wages at last growing faster than prices — just. Earnings excluding bonuses rose an annual 2.9% in the three months through July. The jobless rate held at a 43-year-low of 4%.
text: UK wages at last growing faster than prices — just. Earnings excluding bonuses rose an annual 2.9% in the three months through July. The jobless rate held at a 43-year-low of 4%.

html: It’s clear that many are mourning not just for John McCain but for the ideals he represented - as a man who served his country both in wartime and in peace; who put principle before expediency and who fought for his beliefs but demanded respect for those who didn’t share them.

html: Venezuela was once the richest country in Latin America. It then experienced “21st century socialism” - sky high borrowing, nationalisations, anti-business policies, price controls. html: Of the 107 public #prisons many are doing very well but some are under performing massively eg Nottingham / Exeter Of the 14 privately run prisons some are doing v well but some, like Birmingham = in real trouble. Money / manpower do matter but change comes thru other factors 6/

html: This is not a debate about #private or #public sector #prisons. There are - 107 publicly run prisons - 14 private sector run prisons The private sector is not the enemy here. To argue that is to obfuscate / avoid. Anyone who makes that case eg #RichardBurgon - is an idiot. 5/
text:
This is not a debate about #private or #public sector #prisons. There are 
- 107 publicly run prisons 
- 14 private sector run prisons 
The private sector is not the enemy here. To argue that is to obfuscate / avoid. Anyone who makes that case eg #RichardBurgon - is an idiot. 5/

html: UK government borrowing in 1st 4 months of fiscal 2018/19 lowest in 16 years, helped by the largest surplus -- £2bn -- for July since 2000. Treasury coffers boosted by higher income, payroll, corporate taxes. Suspect OBR will be revising its 18/19 deficit forecast down - again.
text: UK government borrowing in 1st 4 months of fiscal 2018/19 lowest in 16 years, helped by the largest surplus -- £2bn -- for July since 2000. Treasury coffers boosted by higher income, payroll, corporate taxes. Suspect OBR will be revising its 18/19 deficit forecast down - again.

html: Little remarked, but UK Corporation Tax revenue in the last twelve months hit an all-time record high of £58.3bn today: up £10bn compared to the same period just two years ago. Corporation Tax cuts create jobs, raise wages, increase savings, and - yes - boost government revenue.
text:
Little remarked, but UK Corporation Tax revenue in the last twelve months hit an all-time record high of £58.3bn today: up £10bn compared to the same period just two years ago.

Corporation Tax cuts create jobs, raise wages, increase savings, and - yes - boost government revenue.
